title: Patches
content:
This page gives information on patches and how to view them.

Overview

A patch is a software update or modification designed to fix vulnerabilities, bugs, or other issues in an existing program or system. You can import the patches from Server Automation (SA).

Lifecycle of patches

Patches have a predefined workflow representing the lifecycle of every instance within Automation Center.

The phases of a patch have the following metaphases:

  • Draft
  • Active
  • Retired

The lifecycle of a patch has the following transition phases:

Patch Transitions
Transition phase Transition type Description
New > Action Automatic When you import patches from SA, it moves to Action phase.
Action > Retire Manual

When you move the patch to Retire phase in Automation Center.

When you remove a patch in SA, post synchronization, the phase changes to Retire in Automation Center.
Action > Superseded Automatic When a patch supersedes at least one other patch.

Supersede > Retire

 Manual

When you move the patch to Retire phase in Automation Center.

When you remove a patch in SA, post synchronization, the phase changes to Retire in Automation Center.
Retire > New Manual

When you move the patch back to New phase in Automation Center. 

If you add the patch again in SA, it becomes a new entity in SA. Post synchronization from SA to Automation Center, the patch phase changes to New.

Draft

The Draft metaphase contains the following phase:

New: Initial phase for a newly created patch, until the instance has the least required information.

Active

The Active metaphase contains the following phases:

  • Action: The patch has all the required information that you can use. You can attach it to Policies.
  • Superseded: It works like Action but there exists a patch that supersedes this instance.

Retired

The Retired metaphase contains the following phase:

Retire: Patch deleted from source or no longer of interest. You can't attach it to Policies.

View patches

To view the patches:

  1. From the Mega Menu, go to Build > Vulnerability & Remediation > Patches.
  2. To view the full details of a patch, navigate to the details page by clicking the entity’s ID.

Filters

Filters help you filter record lists or define filters for a report. To create a filter, see Filters - Service Management.

Patch details

The patch details contain the following tabs:

General tab

Contains general information on the patch, the Common Vulnerability Exposure (CVE) details, superseded patches, and patches that supersede. The General tab contains the following fields:

general tab
Patch field Description
Name Patch name.
Description Patch description.
File Name The name of the file containing the patch.
KB Knowledge Base ID.
Source Severity The patch severity provided by SA.
Advisory Security Advisory ID number for the patch.
Locale Encoding of the patch contents.
Type The patch type. For example, Windows hotfix, Windows update rollup, or Windows service pack.
Release Date The release date of the patch.
OS Applicable patch for Operating Systems.
Affected Products Products that the patch affects. 
Binary Availability The availability of the patch binary.
Source ID The ID of the patch within SA.
Reason for retiring Reason for retiring the patch. Required to change the phase to Retire.
Owner¹ The person responsible for dealing with the patch.
Owning Group¹ The group responsible for dealing with the patch.

¹ If Owner and Owning Group are not visible (for example, in environments upgraded from 24.3), a user with access to Studio must change the Forms for each entity to make the fields visible.

CVE Details

The CVE details contain a list of CVEs associated with a vulnerability. You can select Add Filter to customize the columns of a CVE. See the following table to add a CVE, remove a CVE, and customize the columns of a CVE.

CVE Details
CVE fields Description
Add You can select Add to add a CVE associated with a vulnerability.
Remove You can select a CVE and click Remove to remove a CVE.
Columns You can add customized columns to a CVE by selecting the filters in columns.

Supersedes

Contains a list of patches that the current patch supersedes. You can select Add Filter to customize the columns of a patch. See the fields under General Tab table to add, remove, and customize columns of a patch.

Superseded By

Contains a list of patches that supersede the current patch. You can select Add Filter to customize the columns of a patch. See the fields under General Tab table to add, remove, and customize columns of a patch.

Workflow tab

Shows the patch instance’s current phase within the lifecycle.

Discussions tab

Displays discussions related to the patch instance.

History tab

Shows the change history of the patch instance.
